description: girl wearing a hat and carrying a short leafed branch, following 3 llamas; central llama saddled with a bundle

Inscription

at lower edge on back, in black: [(
text: In this photograph, a girl is driving three llamas—“walking brown bundles of wool,” as Bischof put it. American camelids such as llamas were very important to ancient Andean people as pack animals and providers of wool and food. In her hand the girl carries a clutch of coca leaves, used to alleviate altitude sickness, fatigue, and hunger.
title: Girl with Llamas, Pisac, Peru
